competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Enterprise database with data warehousing capabilities

competitors.name: Red Brick
competitors.notes: Data warehouse database, acquired by Informix

context: In 2000, Teradata was a division of NCR Corporation (spun off as independent company in 2007). Teradata was the leading specialized data warehouse vendor competing against general-purpose databases from Oracle and IBM. The data warehouse market was growing with e-commerce and CRM analytics demands. Red Brick was a specialized competitor before being acquired. Teradata's massively parallel processing architecture was a key differentiator for large-scale analytics.
